bibl.title: Letter from Caroline Latimer to Howard A. Kelly, November 23, 1908

div1.p: Latimer reports problems with the Carnegie Fund application.

div1.head: Letter from Caroline Latimer to Howard A. Kelly, November 23, 1908
div1.opener:
K.
today
1021 Cathedral St.
Nov. 23, 1908
Dear Dr. Kelly:
div1.p:
When I wrote
you about Kissinger
I enclosed some notes
for use in the answer
to Dr. Ernst, and I
thought I said in
them that Miss Mur-
phy must find out
from Miss Krieger the
exact facts about
the Carnegie applica-
tion. It was made
AC
Ki
by Miss Krieger, after I
left you, and I do not
know the details. All
that I do know is that
it was refused on the
plea that the fund
did not recognize any
services to humanity
rendered before its own
establishment.

I am afraid that I
inadvertently omitted
Miss Krieger's name,
and I am very sorry
to have given you ad-
ditional trouble. by doing
so.
